author: {'steamid': '76561197993320740', 'num_games_owned': 976, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1487422085}
review:
All around, a good game. I found the controls a bit hard to get used to at first, but you adapt easily. It's a fun little two- to four-hour time-waster depending on if you just want a casual romp through the game or if you're going for all the hats and achievements...

...speaking of achievements, the "Steedrun" achievement can, with all due respect, go f*ck itself. You will die. You will die often. You will die in easily preventable ways. And each death will force you to go back to the hub world and re-enter, wasting countless minutes that turn into hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007655039', 'num_games_owned': 1248, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1487445531}
review:
When it sticks to it's short but challenging platforming levels that respawn you at the last safe place you touched before you die it's at it's best.

The boss fights detract from this experience in forcing you to replay from the beginning after too many deaths, making them much more frustrating than the rest of the game (although this is far from the only reason they are frustrating)

Despite the flaws it's a nice little game that you'll get a few good, but sometimes rage inducing hours out of.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040849065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1486694341}
review:
I just played through this game's main storyline in one session. Here's what I think:

The Good:
+ The beam gun and the flinging shotgun are innovative plattforming mechanics.
+ The levels are visually varied and generally well designed. Checkpoints are usually placed quite generously and fairly.
+ Each chapter introduces new temporary environmental mechanics, which makes for a shortwhiled experience.
+ The overall pacing of the levels is quite good, none of the chapters or mechanics outstay their welcome.
+ Collecting hats is  a fun way to customise your character and provides a nice layer of additional challenge in most stages.
+ Some of the hats are downright ridiculous and so is the main stoyline. The humour is definitely debatable, very slapstick-esque and lol-so-random, but I think it's safe to say that if the trailer for this game appeals to you then you will enjoy the plot.
+ The original soundtrack kicks ass and is surprisingly varied.
+ The voice acting is ridiculously over the top and probably the main contributing factor to this game's hillarity.
+ The meta-commentary on video games and game design seemed a little out of place, but I enjoyed it regardless.
+ Steam Workshop support, additional levels, and the challenge of trying to collect all the hats and all the achievements should be enough incentive to keep playing for those masochistic enough to want to do so.

The Bad:
- In almost every chapter there will be one stage that is extremely hard in comparison to the rest. This seems in part due to these stages having less generous checkpoints than usual or sometimes none at all. These random difficulty spikes can be very frustrating and are a testament to the fact that this was a debut game by a small company. Definitely could have used some more playtesting.

- The game keeps its promise to not explain anything. You have to figure out every new mechanic by yourself and make creative use of your movement abilites to forge your path through the levels. This is of course where the challenge of the game comes from, but I think it is safe to say it does not hold your hand. As a result, I sometimes found myself having to cross-references videos of other people's playthroughs to make sure my approach to traversing the level was correct and it was only my execution that sucked.

- The bossfights in particular are quite hard. They all have set rotations that you'll have to figure out for yourself. The game generally tries to give visual and auditive clues as to what you should be doing, but oftentimes it is unclear how many stages a fight has. Bosses also never have a healthbar, instead the game relies purely on different visual stages of the bosses' models which makes the progress of the fight feel vague at times.

-Playing the game with a controller seemed fine, but there were a few stages where I found myself switching back to mouse and keyboard as the chapter-specific mechanics seemed easier to handle that way.

- The main campaign can be finished in around 3-4 hours. This might be a consideration for some people, although as I said the game is overall very enjoyable and shortwhiled.

- The original price tag of 15 euros/dollars is a little too high in my opinion. Although it's definitely worth picking up on sale for a reduced price, probably more around the 5-8 euros/dollars mark.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080969908', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1486176037}
review:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie 

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

________________________________________________

Anyways, love the simple aspect of the game.

Pros:
- A lot of levels
- Fun and simple graphics
- About everyone can run this game
- YOUR CHARACTER IS CONSTANTLY SCREAMING


Cons:
-YOUR CHARACTER IS CONSTANTLY SCREAMING

author: {'steamid': '76561198047903521', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1511995693}
review:
I loved the first game. Despite some serious issues (Hit Glitches, Bosses crashing the game, etc) I still loved the game and was able to enjoy it and ignore the bugs. Not only does the Remastered improve on some of the issues the first game had (Better Hat selection, fixed glitches and Boss fights) but also has a lot of improved controls and overall is just amazing. If you enjoyed the first game this is basically the same and much more improved.

If you're new then this game is amazing. Easy to play, hard to master. Funny story and beautiful graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045376199', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1590115854}
review:
"I Am You From The Future! No Time To Explain, Buy This Game noooOH CHRIST!" 

My future self is very happy with having purchased this game.  It will put a smile on your face.  The graphics are simple, but fun.  The controls are simple but fun.  The story is simple but fun.   This leaves you with a game that is simple and fun! 
The story is wacky and fast-paced, don't look for too much here; however this is exactly what a timetravel/parallel dimension based story should be.  Every level and world is just long enough for you to feel satisfied with your success, but short enough that you never feel bogged down, even if you fail and have to retry it.  The worlds are not too long, yet the variety of puzzels changes frequently enough to always be satisfiying. 
The music is good too!  I think I heard a jingle from Top Gear!

TL;DR: Worthwhile game, simple but fun! Get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198119410545', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1484240345}

author: {'steamid': '76561198096721031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1483342968}
review:
Worth during extreme discount only. Not worth full price.

The wonky controls first introduced in the game are fun and entertaining initially. However, as soon as you make it to the levels where you need some level of percision, the controls make it impossible to do.  Perhaps its not intented for remote play but the controls are the downfall of this game. Also beat the story of this game in only 2 hours. That wouldn't have been an issue, if the first level immidiately available after thecampaign wasn't impossible.
I ended up returning my $3.5 purchase.

review:
Welp, the game is solid 5/10.

There are plenty of things I actually liked in this game, like oldschool flash graphics or crazy plot that doesn't make any sense.

Gameplay is kinda simple - mechanics are fun and intuitive, however the controls make everything bit clunky.

Getting 100% achievs isn't a big deal, the game is short and some harder parts are just frustrating trial/error jumps rather than actual challenging speedruns/YOLO runs.

I don't even know if I'd recommend this game to anyone. I'd like to say why but I've got no time to explain this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286956439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483152634}
review: Anyone that says the beam gun is inconsistent hasn't spent the time to actually learn the physics and controls of the game. With practice you can become pretty good with the beam gun. This is a hardcore platformer. If you don't like those types of games, you should not play this game. New gameplay elements get added for certain levels to break up the monotony of the beam gun. These types of games can be very satisfying to complete difficult levels. The levels are short and challenging. The bosses are big with weaknesses and patterns to learn. The only thing that I don't like about this game is that there doesn't seem to be anyway to save mid-world. You have to play to and beat the boss before you quit or you're playing the whole world again next time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064381211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1483070840}
review:
This game is very frustrating and not fun at all. The core mechanic of the game the laser gun is unpredictable and hard to control. The physics feel very wonky. As far as the levels go they are alright, but navigating them with the laser gun is terrible. The game is somewhat forgiving when you die, you just respawn on the last safe ledge you were on. The worlds all end with a boss that is annoying to fight. The bosses don't even have health bars so there is no way to gauge how long you have to suffer through the fight. God forbid you quit to take a break because the game resets your world progress on exit. The story is non-existent and the writing is god awful and relies on "random" humor that was only funny in the early 2000's.

Overall I wouldn't even bother with this game unless you want the trading card drops like me. It isn't boring to play, it's painful to play and a negative experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006580639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1514405046}
review:
While this game has a some unique mecahnics it has 3 major problems.

1) Lack of a tutorial. It wasn't until the Shotgun guy that I realise I could move my character other than using their weapon.

2) Poor level design in some levels. You automatically respawn on the last land you touched but on some levels it's possible to fall back to a lower level, forcing you to repeat most of the level. Some levels also lack any land so you have to repeat the whole level if you make a single mistake.

3) You can only select a stage but not an individual level. So if you stop playing part way through a stage you have to repeat all the levels in this stage. This is especially annoying when there's a lot of levels or a few are very difficult.

Until you can select levels the player will continue to be punished for giving up half way through a stage.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961801742', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1469659385}
review:
9/10: Figure out what the heck's going wrong with reality by using your sweet blaster to maneuver and sometimes shoot bosses. A fun platformer with just the right amount of meta to show it isn't taking itself too seriously.

No Time to Explain starts out with the player character warning themselves about future danger before the future copy is snatched away by a giant lobster claw. It only gets wierder from there. Worlds of riches, candy, football, Soviet Union, madness, and more must be overcome by mastering the force exerted from your awesome blaster gun and adapting to the switches in mechanics and environments. 

Any game where getting fat on cake is a platforming mechanic has the right mentality to earn my thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015122235', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1482257440}
review: Game is essentially unplayable the way it's meant to be played, because the core game element does not work - you're intended to use your beam gun's recoil to move about the map, but it's unbelievably inconsistent in how much recoil it provides you, so while you can with practice predict where the gun will move you, that movement varies over the course of firing the gun, which makes beam-jumping incredibly frustrating in practice.  There's a particular jump I just spent 15 minutes failing to accomplish to acquire a hat, and I am tired of beating my head against the wall when I know exactly what I want to do - the controls just aren't good enough to make it happen (the jump is exceedingly simple - I just need enough height, which the gun can't decide whether or not to provide me with).

review:
"No Time To Explain" Ã¨ un platform semplice e divertente. In alcuni tratti puÃ² risultare impegnativo, senza tuttavia essere frustrante. Azzeccata la combinazione arma/propulsore che spinge il giocatore a ragionare prima di agire e non a fare innumerevoli tentativi suicida nella speranza di essere fortunati.
La storia Ã¨ carina, anche se risulta frenetica e breve... tuttavia non mi sento di criticare questo aspetto, in quanto il titolo stesso del gioco risulta abbastanza chiaro su questo punto.

Molto consigliato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089620600', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1521838805}
review:
The moment I played the demo they put on Newgrounds, I was like, [b]"I gotta have it!"[/b] So I went to buy it and, in my opinion, is one of the best games I've ever played!
It has everything you'd expect from crazy future stuff:
[list]
[*] Lasers
[*] Time-traveling
[*] Crazy monsters 
[*] And, as the title says, no explanation for what's going on
[/list]

This game made me feel like a kid, honest. Especially with the comedy they add to it, makes it for me even more special to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072126161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1675581484}
review: Probably the most fun I've had in a unity (and flash) game. The plot is as ludicrous as it is hilarious, every boss is awesome and fun to beat, lazors, the game is challenging and collecting the hats is a fun side-mission and post game. I've had fun with both the original and remastered, so if you like any of the things listed above, you need this game :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198035808481', 'num_games_owned': 1652, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1480968551}
review:
No time to explain is a platformer where the larger part of gameplay consists of you using the recoil of a LAZOR to navigate and sometimes shoot at stuff. I say the larger part because this is also the first part where it shines: gameplay.

There is a surprising amount of different gameplay mechanics and they are why the game stays fresh each level. Perhaps some of them could have been explored further as they go on for like 4 levels and maybe a bossfight and then are dropped again forever. 

Then again the game is very very short all together and can be beat in just a small handful of hours. I think it is too short for full price but adequate at a decent sale. However if you add community created levels you have nigh infinite gametime, so that is nice.

The music is very nice and fitting to the levels. Maybe not a soundtrack you'd buy but one you will totally enjoy.

The story is barely there but there is no time to explain and it isnt neccesary either. 

One last thing: respawn points. This game can be pretty damn tough and you will die quite a lot. However the respawn is always whereever you stood on safe and solid ground last. This isnt too frequent but actually important as it is often that one jump you fail 20 times, so that it is good that all you have to actually do is that one jump. There is a couple of situations with differing gameplay (fire anyone?) where death sets you back much farther and it gets annoying pretty quickly in those cases.

Some decent humor strewn throughout too.

Really if that first trailer convinces you and its cheap at the moment I would totally reccommend you get this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056773776', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1474750529}
review: Game has fun concept but it's too annoying to play due to really strange gameplay mechanics and too long boss fights like seriously... You have mostly do same thing 4 times in a boss fight which is problem since some of them has random and total bs movesets and I always lost focus after I did the same thing 3 times in a row and rest of the boss fight was just boring and frustrating in a bad way... I can see that this game is worth only for youtubers/streamers who will get a lot of money from their bored and frustrated faces, also there's not settings so I coulnd't even set it to 1080p fullscren since the game is locked in some weird resolution that  can't be cahnged so you have to look at the annoying frames on both sides...

author: {'steamid': '76561198043675868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1473916513}
review:
I actually have plenty of time to explain this train wreck, and boy do I need it. 

So, a platforming shooter where you use your gun for both damage and movement. Pretty unique concept, and each world uses a unique mechanic to keep things interesting. However, it's riddled with control problems. Most significantly, this is the only platformer of this type that I've played where your crosshair moves WITH your character, so if you're moving quickly it's nigh impossible to aim. What's more, if you move your cursor off the screen it actually goes off the screen. You'd expect it to stay around the edge so you can see where you're aiming, but no. There's also a moronic feature where if you fall a long distance your character lands on his face and has to stand up, preventing you from moving for a second. I don't know if this was added for "comedic" value or to make the game harder, but it feels terrible and goes against the core idea of a platformer.

The level design is just bad and unintuitive. There are so many parts where you need precision and the game isn't capable of being that precise, so you're stuck throwing yourself around until you get the angle just right. At least you aren't punished for dying.

The writing is bland, it's the sort of "random" style that's targeted at kids and young teenagers and typical of a flash game. I won't fault them for that, I know I used to enjoy that type of humour. The music is unremarkable, and I even noticed that they blatantly ripped of a song from an SNES game. Worst of all, somehow the game's optimized poorly enough that I actually dipped below 60fps on occasion, and I don't think I've ever lagged in a flash game before.

I think I got to the second last world before I called it quits. There were more frustrating elements than what I detailed here, just so many terrible design choices and make for a truly frustrating experience. It's playable, so I rate it a 2/10, but it sure isn't fun, and it certainly isn't worth $15.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038897931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1473547574}
review:
Wow, just .. wow!

I thought this game was just a silly prototype/flash game/whatever, but after actually playing it, it's an incredible mix of a platformer, shooter, puzzle game, and various other genres I normally wouldn't even imagine would go together well.

Different mechanics, interesting level design and just-hard-enough bosses, this game isn't boring at any point.
For an additional challenge, try getting all the hats in the game - the challenge isn't finding them, but getting to them :)

A must play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198136425897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1526046047}
review:
This game is so good, I just loved it ! The scenario and dialogues are hilarious and I love this game, it may be hard sometimes, but it's worth it ! The gameplay is really good as well ^^ 
I think I'm gonna play again this game when I have the occasion, because it's a really cool and funny game ! We also get a really awesome music :D
The story doesn't make sense, but it makes sense in the non-makingsense, I don't know how to explain it, but I loved it ^^ I really recommend this game to everyone who would wish to buy this game :) Thanks the devs for making such a good work, even though you guys from TinyBuildGames suffered from many issues, you managed to make an awesome game !

I am you from the future, I took time to explain :p Buy this game :D As I'm you from the future, I know you'll love it :p

PS : I wanted this game for a long time, but couldn't pay for it, and I got it for free, don't know why, but thank you so much Steam and TinyBuildGames, for this awesome game !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009548473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1474500287}
review:
Mourse cursor leaves the border of the game while playing, completely ruining the entire premise of the game, which is precise aiming/control to mouve around and navigate levels.

Would absolutely not recommend until this is fixed, or some sort of option is added to prevent this from happening. 

When your cursor leaves the screen you have no idea where it is or where you're aiming, making certain aspects (like precise flying) much harder than they need to be because you literally can't see where you're aiming. Not very fun at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049183341', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1471620821}
review:
Un [b]original plataformas 2D[/b] muy centrando en el "ensayo y error" en el cual deberemos ir [b]pasando niveles con distintos artilugios.[/b]

Es un juego llenito de humor (con un doblaje al inglÃ©s brutal) que [b]no deja de sorprenderte hasta el final[/b] con nuevos artilugios y formas de pasarnos los niveles. AdemÃ¡s, a veces tiene un [b]"toquecillo" puzzle.[/b]

Su banda sonora estÃ¡ graciosa, tiene [b]jefes finales[/b], sombreritos que coleccionar, logros (estos van unidos a lo anterior dicho), [b]niveles extra al pasarte la "historia" principal[/b] y [b]Workshop[/b], para crear y subir niveles o jugar los de los demÃ¡s jugadores.

Â¿Puntos negativos? La dificultad de algunos niveles puede acabar [b]desesperando[/b], el juego es [b]cortito[/b] ([b]2-3 horas[/b], segÃºn lo que mueras y lo hÃ¡bil que seas) y el [b]precio es excesivo[/b] para lo que es (es un juego hecho con flash que no dura mÃ¡s de 2-3 horas)

Lo recomiendo si buscas un plataformas 2D [b]fresco[/b] y/o si [b]te gustÃ³ Portal[/b], ya que la originalidad de los distintos artilugios y como nos las tendremos que ingeniar para pasar algunos niveles te recordarÃ¡ a Ã©l.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997809014', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1437453770}
review:
This is one game of the game companies that ruined kickstarters for me. They came in, promised a working game. I didn't expect much, didn't give that much either but it got funded. Then it took a while for the game to finish (makes sense). When it finally released it was complete garbage. I could hardly get the game running. Constant stuttering. Poor controls, I aim at the ground but I'm not going up. Sometimes I shoot up high in the sky but only when I don't want to. To me this was a Tiny Build game. This was acceptable for them to sell. This was their first and last game I was ever going to buy.

Now here's the Remastered version. Years after the poor version was released. It was their 'We are sorry' gift to their backers. I played it. It no longer had stuttering and lag, I could actually finish it, but too bad the controls still sucked. All my optimism for the game was gone. It's stupid short, can be all finished within two hours.

So no, I don't recommend this game. It's mediocre. Defintly no where near woth $14.99. At best it's a $5.00 game that you play once.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985483363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1473488510}
review:
Simple, direct and funny.
This platformer will deliever some good laughts and a [b]always[/b]-changing gameplay with a smooth difficulty curve.
The variety of the game and the nonsensical humor are well balanced here.

[h1]Oh, you want a challenge?[/h1]
Worry not. Skilled players can defy themselves to gather the "secret" collectible hats scattered along the levels. The game is cool with that and tells you exatly how many not-so-secret hats are left in each level before you enter them. These hats contribute a lot to the replayability of the game as it usually requires a sharper skill to get and, sometimes, even thinking outside the box =)

[h1]Oh, you still want a bigger challenge??[/h1]
Look no further to some of the achievements of the game. After beating the game, these are sure to test your platformer skills.

Interesting game. And it's unexpensive for it's content too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972351208', 'num_games_owned': 949, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1471311808}
review:
Fun reverse-motion movement platformer with a strong sense of irreverancy, and good variety.  Generally solid but simplistic level design and bosses.  You're going to probably love or hate the humour, and that's a significant portion of the purchase.

Why's this not recommended?  Well, for one thing, the gun is pretty touchy- whether it raises you or not on occasion seems to be entirely random.  I also felt a certain boss, a giant machine mole, was basically made to bore you (not literally, although it can certainly do that) particularly if you don't realize that what looks to be a tell is actually the weakspot.  Finally, and most importantly, it's basically around two hours long for sixteen bucks, and that's very hard to recommend, even on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091686266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1474233337}
review:
A great game in the Rage style where the stages are quite fun to explore and the heads are where you question: "is it worth? Really worth going through it? ".
With dynamic phases and simple gameplay, No Time To Explain, you can easily win both his cute way and by this blood (perfect match right?).
The story itself is almost nonexistent, just a backdrop for everything that is provided by both the laser gun as the shotgun, with such weapons I ask you for a story would be necessary?
The game has stages which are divided into "worlds" that have short phases and at the end of a boss, where everything is well run to reach the boss and at the moment we must deal differently because their lives that most of the phases is infinite, facing heads are reduced to 3. Believe me, this amount is insufficient to really give you a fair chance to win.
Besides the story mode there is the convey of the workshop that can extend the life of the game for a while, it depends solely on you.
The game has hats and heads to unlock, you can also extend over the game, if you want all and not get them first.
I could spend hours talking about this fantastic game and which I really recommend, however "No Time To Explain!"

PS: In my gambling have not encountered any bug.

For similar Steamified Reviews and Giveaways, please visit http://www.steamified.com/ .
Also you're welcome to join in the fun in our Steamified group.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052923492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1483055685}
review:
I am you from the future, and you should get this game. THERE IS NO TIME TO EXPLAIN!!! At first, when I saw this game in my library, I was a little skeptical if this game was any good at all. When I gave this game a chance, I had a blast playing through the game.

If you love platformers like Super Meat Boy, then this game is just for you. This game splits up its levels really nicely so you can revisit small parts of the story without playing through all of it again. This game is fun, funny, and challenging. At first, the controls and mechanics are somewhat difficult to get used to, but when you do, it's hella fun. As you play along, the game will introduce new styles of movements which will challenge your coordination skills.

This game is kind of expensive for how much it offers, but you should totally get this game if you want a challenging platformer to test your skills. It took me around 3 hours to get all the achievements and to finish the game. The rest of my time is from workshop maps. I would recommend waiting till there is a sale or when this game gets cheaper. When the game does get cheaper, then take your kids' lunch money and buy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994222878', 'num_games_owned': 2475, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1470890457}
review:
I received this game for free for owning the original release. I've completed the original product, so I only opened this up to see if it was better and to get card drops, hence my low hours.

This release fixes a few of my complaints over the original, such as the colour filter bug and a few boss issues, but I still don't really like it. It's got a fun idea and a good concept, but it hammers it to the point of irritation with so much screaming and 'randomness' that it's incoherent and just gives me a headache after a few minutes.

The gameplay is actually really unique and I like it. If it was a more straightforward story and less annoying audio, I wouldn't be so hard on it. If you want to play it for the gameplay, mute the audio and ignore the flashy crap going on. Otherwise, it's a solid concept lost in a garbage pile of nonsense and far too much screaming. Random does not equal funny, especially for more an hour or two of gameplay priced at $15.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069604938', 'num_games_owned': 815, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1470501776}
review:
[h1]"A gamepad is not required, neither is bathing... Think about it!" - Super Meat Boy[/h1]

No Time to Explain is a wild ride, full of wit, and a very unique and challenging platformer.
I'd recommend this game to anyone looking for a fantastic Local Co-Op experience.
It has it's own place in a list including, Super Meat Boy, Battle Block Theater, and Castle Crashers.

The time put into this game on my profile is incorrect. 
If you're an experienced platformer, but not speedrun tier, expect 2 1/2 - 4 hours of a completionist playthrough. 
I played it offline with friends of mine while on deployment overseas.
Stage by stage, my friends and I raged, laughed, and cried.
Killing the end boss was extremely satisfying.

Recommended Buy, 9/10.

Jak chodzi gra? Gra dziaÅ‚a pÅ‚ynnie, nie to co poprzednia wersja gry bez dopisku Remastered, ktÃ³ra byÅ‚a ledwo grywalna i chyba za Å‚atwa. Jedyny zarzut mam do sterowania, gÅ‚Ã³wny zarzut mam do mechaniki poruszania siÄ™ kursora wraz z postaciÄ…, ktÃ³ra w Å‚atwy sposÃ³b znajduje siÄ™ poza ekranem gry, co czasami przeszkadza, z innych to sterowanie z uÅ¼yciem karabinu odrzutowego w powietrzu jest trudne do okieÅ‚znania, bo postaÄ‡ jest troszkÄ™ dzika i trudno jest wyczuÄ‡ ruch. Poza sterowaniem reszta jest ok.

PodsumowujÄ…c:
+FabuÅ‚a z humorem
+Zabawny gameplay
+InteresujÄ…ce poziomy i postacie
+Muzyka, ktÃ³ra miejscami jest Å›wietna
+Grafika jak grafika przynajmniej nie jest zÅ‚a
+Optymalizacja
+Ciekawa mechanika rozgrywki
+-Gra moÅ¼e nie jest trudna, ale problem sterowania troszkÄ™ wpÅ‚ywa na ten aspekt
+-To sterowanie jest trochÄ™ mÄ™czÄ…ce i delikatnie nieresponsywne, ale jako tako jest do przeÅ‚kniÄ™cia
-DÅ‚uga to nie jest, ale duÅ¼o nie bÄ™dÄ™ wymagaÅ‚ od takiej gry
Moja ocena to 8,5/10, gra jest zabawna i ma interesujÄ…cy gameplay oraz sÄ… znajdÅºki, ale czasami walczymy ze sterowaniem. Czy polecam grÄ™? Jak najbardziej.
PS. Wersja Remastered byÅ‚a za darmo dla posiadaczy tej zwykÅ‚ej wersji zabugowanej, dlatego zaznaczam, Å¼e wersja Remastered byÅ‚a mi dana za darmo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026317882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1468703165}
review:
A decent platformer in the "super hard but small levels with easy restarts" hardcore sub-genre of platformers whose poster child is Super Meat Boy.

The controls are a bit floaty/unpredictable, but the game always restart you instantly at the last platform so failure doesn't sting and it's easy to retry again and again until you succeed. Though many levels are standard fare for that type of game, the "laser beam jump" mechanic is well exploited, with many variations, and there are a few levels that are really clever and/or funny. 

Finally, the crazy story and different settings for levels will keep the game fresh enough. If you stick to it, you should be able to finish this game in a few hours, making it a good time waster that doesn't outlast its welcome.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974293214', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1467873280}
review:
I have never played the original, but it is clear [i]No Time to Explain Remastered[/i] was originally a Flash game. I enjoyed Flash games growing up and this game overall was pretty enjoyable. It's short, simple, and sweet. This game start to finish only took an hour or two with collecting everything and there is even a Steam workshop for custom levels though I only played a few before stopping. The reason being is this game has too much of a simple repetition manner to keep playing. Aside from basic WASD movement, the only thing you do is point and shoot to, for the most part, move further. There also is a sorta-is-but-not-really a humorous storyline that was enjoyable and gave me a few laughs here and there. Overall this game was good though I doubt I'd play it again.

Overall : â˜… â˜… â˜… â˜† â˜†

author: {'steamid': '76561198043903124', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1468277405}
review:
Game crashes if I try to switch out of fullscreen mode.
No discernable consistency with regards to maximum achievable height from using the weapon to jump, which is kind of an issue in a platformer based in that mechanic. 
Even the limited options menus are a chore to get through, as the volume control bars, among other options, don't even work the same way consistenly, if you can manage to highlight them.

If this game functioned exactly as I believe it was intended to, it wouldn't have been worth $15. If you're really that interested in a fairly mediocre, could-and-should-be-a-browser-game platformer, at least wait for a significant sale, or, like me, be surprised that it magically appeared in your library seemingly out of nowhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069529464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1698284450}
review:
Being a fan of the original No Time To Explain, I was pleasantly surprised to have received this for free.  

Contentwise, No Time To Explain Remastered is just what one would expect from a remaster: Smoother and faster.  Innuendos aside, it's a more stable and enjoyable experience than the original.  

The frames have improved, to name one example, but whether or not that's a consistent among every computer is debatable.  

The laser gun, dimension hopping madness fun is still prevalent, and with the smoother gameplay fixes, they serve as fun, if not short and sweet challenges that ooze with a uniqueness that only comes with in a giant robot crab package, and I would recommend it to those looking for a funny and fun little game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066662864', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1467940795}
review:
Have no idea how I got this game... here's how that all went :
1- Wondered, then "let's give it a try!". Was a bit hesitating when I saw that resolution, but heh, why not?
2- Had fun for about 30 minutes, a no big challenge there, just a guy with a BIG GUN
3- Continued to play, began to find more tricky puzzles, but was really hard to solve. Why? Because physic is RANDOM! Your jump height and velocity is not determined by how you shoot, it is determined by RNJesus!
4- Tried to kill a boss. His hitbox was not always the same, even though the pattern was. "Safe" spots bring you to die.
5- Uninstalled.
This game could be quite good if movements were less random-dependants... It also gets repetitive really fast...
Only grab it if there's a big sale on it, and if you like platformers

author: {'steamid': '76561198089843987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1467480786}
review:
The humor was definitely there in the beginning, what with your future self being severely mutilated right in front of you, but after a little while, the humor dies down when you realize that's it. Every level you start off in shows another version of you being dragged off with spurts of blood and screaming in agony, but it starts to get tedious and annoying, especially when you keep dying while trying to figure out how to proceed to the next level. And once that humor is gone, all you're left with is a kind of mediocre platformer. The idea of using your gun's momentum to traverse the area is pretty cool, but it falls kind of flat simply because what sells this game is the weird, quirky randomness of the trailer, not so much the game. 

I think another major difference here is the controller. It has the full support, but if you're someone like me who always prefers the controller to the mouse and keyboard, you'll have a harder time. Like with almost any FPS game, using the mouse is infinitely more accurate and quicker than trying to orient yourself with the stick. Normally that's not too much of a problem, but when the difference between a success and failure is a split second decision of where to aim the gun, it can be pretty jarring since you have no clear indicator of where you're aiming until you shoot. Not only that, but the stick just feels sluggish anfd I always feel like I'm overcompensating on turns trying to figure out where to orient myself when the mouse would probably feel more fluid.

If you fall into my kind of category, where you bought the game because you thought it would be a good laugh, and you prefer the gamepad, the novelty will wear off really quick. This is more like a game that you play with your drinking buddies on the weekends to just laugh at each other's failings. And maybe most importantly, is the price. This game doesn't scream out $15 to me. I feel that's too overpriced. If you really want to get this, I would wait for a sale.

VoilÃ  pour les cÃ´tÃ©s positifs.

Les contrÃ´les du jeu sont vraiment peu prÃ©cis > pas de clavier azerty de base pour les commandes, le curseur qui disparait hors de l'Ã©cran au lieu d'en coller le bord et des petits bugs de temps en temps.

Le jeu n'explore pas assez ses propres mÃ©caniques de jeu et ses diffÃ©rents "fusils Ã  pouvoir". Il ne fait qu'effleurer ce qui pourrait Ãªtre vraiment ingÃ©nieux et grisant pour laisser au final une impression de travail bÃ¢clÃ© et une expÃ©rience limite frustrante. Vraiment dommage.

Le design ne me plaÃ®t pas mais Ã§a c'est subjectif.

Le jeu est trÃ¨s court : 5h pour le finir (en recommenÃ§ant quelques niveaux pour certains succÃ¨s).

Au final je ne recommande pas ce jeu, mÃªme si je l'ai eu gratuitement (oui c'est trÃ¨s gentil toussa toussa), car ceux qui viendront voir ces Ã©valuations ne l'auront pas gratuitement, eux. Et je ne soutiens pas le fait que le jeu ait un pourcentage d'Ã©valuations positives disproportionnÃ© seulement parce qu'il est gratuit (Ã§a serait trop facile).

author: {'steamid': '76561198109705599', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1467172242}
review:
(play time is inaccurate, due to offline mode)

No TIme To Explain is a 2D action platformer where you have a laser that can be used to damage enemies, and has enough recoil to act as a makeshift jetpack. You use that recoil to jump and fly your way past increasingly dangerous obstacles to get to the end goal on each level. The game spices things up by giving you other characters that each have their own way of getting around, but that's most of the game.

The story is simple and manages to be humorous the whole time. As you go on it becomes an increasingly silly tale of aliens, alternate realities, and time-traveling evil twins.

Is it worth it? Maybe not for 16 CAD, unless you [b]REALLY[/b] like platformers. But on sale this charming title is definitely worth picking up.

review:
Les points positifs:
 +Le jeu est trÃ¨s fun, son histoire et ses personnages.
 +Les graphismes ont leurs charmes.
 +Le gameplay. En effet ce jeu n'est pas qu'un jeu de plateforme standard, il y a plusieurs mondes avec leurs boss et leurs particularitÃ©s (comment se dÃ©placer, objets)...
 +Les musiques.

Les points nÃ©gatifs:
 -Certains passages sont assez durs. Et rÃ©sultent plus sur de la chance qu'autre chose (mais dans l'ensemble c'est trÃ¨s faisable) 
 -Jeu en Anglais, avec les dialogues en anglais sans sous-titre. 
 -Il vous faudra quelques minutes pour arriver Ã  voler convenablement.

Conclusion: c'est un trÃ¨s bon jeu, original et fun, avec une bonne histoire, des graphismes charmants et une bonne soundtrack. Jeu Ã  recommander!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065200496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1467237238}
review:
Oh hey! I just noticed that I have a second version of No Time To Explain! maybe this one is optimized and wont lag my computer really bad after a few levels. Its cool of the devs to give me this since I owned the old one. Oh, they added lives to the boss fights? But theyre so annoying! Theyre not even that well made for the mechanics of the game. Actually they ARE well made, TO BE ANNOYING AND UNFUN! 

Hey you have a lazer that knocks you back? 
WELL FUCK YOU HERES SOME SPIKES AND UN AVOIDABLE DEATH RAYS TO PUNISH YOU FOR NOT BEING ABLE TO STAND STILL. 

It was a mild inconvinance until I got to this giant ball of light boss who was so annoyingly made I gave up after 4 rounds of lives. Not because he was too hard no! I love Dark Souls, Rogue Legacy, and other games with similarlly high difficulty curves, no I gave up do to how completly unfun it was to play. 

It has magnets that look like theyre from after effects or photoshop that make your lazer curve, which would be awesome for some levels, BUT NOT FOR A BOSS. Espically when the boss already can turn the ground into electricity which insta kills you, and that last to long to hover over. No you have to stand on the junk that falls from the ceiling! Sounds like a clever design no? Untill you realize doing so puts you in danger of being insta killed by more falling junk.
 No big deal cause you can kill it with the lazer right? WRONG! Rememeber the lazers? Yeah you cant aim straight! And your hitbox is bigger then the lazers so even if you point right up, and its curving way to the side, you die! Stand in the middle then away from the magnets?  Nope! Because when the ball turns the ground into electricity it does so by plunging down! So it kills you there to. Literally nowhere is safe, you cant defend yourself, and you get about 2-3 seconds to actually damage the boss. Fucking terrible.

Rest of the game is probably great, but I dont know because its bosses are so fucking bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106330301', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1533392799}
review:
This is a fun game. Your future self is taken by a crab so you have this plasma weapon thing to boost you. However, really far into the game, the controls are messed up.
SPOILER ALERT!!



After your evil self knocks you out, you have a new style of gameplay. It is really glitchy, so its hard to complete. REALLY HARD.
Other than that, I like the game alot. I reccomend it. Just try not to rage so much that you break your computer/laptop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025792699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1506093926}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055543312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1486254809}
review:
Not what I was expecting...

I havn't heard anything about this game before I played it (so all I knew about it was the trailer I looked up), and it randomly appeared in my Steam game library, so I figured...wtf... might as well see what it's about. I gave it a good amount of time, tried to play some of the levels and defeat a couple bosses, but after a while I got bored with it. The story wasn't interesting enough to keep me entertained, and I found some of the levels so frustrating that completing the game just wasn't worth my pain and agony. I think the concept was cool, and the story had potential, but the gameplay wasn't fun, there are far too many things that should be improved about the game in terms of how the lives work when fighting bosses and overall player movement.

After playing, I honestly can't figure out why people like this game, but that's my own opinion (obviously). So while I personally don't recommend this game, you could still find something great about it that I didn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1464349906}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review, if you want a full review, then please read better reviews then mine [/h1]

I am you from the future, there's no time to explain follow me to the- OH CHRIST! AAAAAAAHHHHHH!

No Time To Explain and it's remastered counterpart is developed and published by tinyBuild Games (love you guys!) The game is challenging but it's fun and easy to pick up and play!

No Time To Explain's humor is really funny and I love the voice actor who plays the guy with the ray thingy. It has cool and unique assets and good local multiplayer

The only thing I would complain about is sometimes the game can get too hard and frustrating especially with the ray thingy you get in the beginning of the game also sometimes the game glitches whilst respawning

I can't understand why the game got remastered because I see no difference between the original and this remastered version unlike games like The Binding of Issac and it's remastered counterpart

No Time To Explain: Remastered is a fun game to play but too frustrating for me to play also, if you purchase SpeedRunners, you will receive No Time To Explain: Remastered for free! (This can be a limited offer after this review is published, so sorry if you don't get the game for free!)

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

review: No Time To Explain is a gun physique platformer. You use your gun to jump from one place to another while avoiding the obstacles. It's pretty hard and rage inducing, lots of trial and error. The story itself is funny and random. Some says this game is short (I haven't finished it, too hard for me). Worth to buy when on sale if you like rage game.

review: Easily one of my new favourites.  No Time To Explain is a masterpiece waiting for you to play...  Again, and again, and again.  And again.  Did I mention again?  Yes?  Oh, okay, then.  How's about you, you, you, you, and you (the last ones are from the future, but I have No Time To Explain that here) fight evil you through lots of levels and puzzles that have tons of replayability and aggrivatingly good soundtracks?  Still not enough?  Well, get it and see for yourselves.  'Cause I ain't got time to explain no more.

review:
Je n'ai pas jouÃ© Ã  la version de base donc je ne ferais pas de comparatif sur ce que la Remastered a amÃ©liorÃ© ou pas. 

Le jeu vaut surtout pour son aspect totalement dÃ©lirant. Chaque nouvelle zone est l'occasion de se lÃ¢cher pour les dÃ©veloppeurs autant dans les environnements, l'histoire et le gameplay. Le level design est assez pauvre, les graphismes sont sommaires, mais la direction artistique rÃ©ussie et le bruitage de l'arme de base trÃ¨s agaÃ§ant.
La durÃ©e de vie est assez courte pour voir la fin du mode solo et quelques zones bonus s'ouvrent ensuite pour rallonger un peu la sauce.

Objectivement, il mÃ©rite le coup d'Å“il si vous avez Speedrunners dans votre bibliothÃ¨que, ce qui fait que vous l'avez aussi sans forcÃ©ment le savoir.
Personnellement, je me suis vraiment amusÃ© Ã  parcourir le jeu avec son aspect complÃ¨tement barrÃ©. On sent vraiment une volontÃ© de faire un jeu amusant et la dÃ©couverte des environnements, des diffÃ©rentes capacitÃ©s de son personnage y sont pour beaucoup.

Si vous l'avez, installez le et testez pour vous faire une idÃ©e (En moins de 5H, il est pliÃ©). J'ai testÃ© la maniabilitÃ© au clavier/ souris et Ã  la manette. Les deux sont parfaitement jouables avec une petite prÃ©fÃ©rence pour la manette.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042819918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1462661299}
review: The straight-jacket chapter is completely broken.  The game plays like a cahrm until then- the game lags terribly with no proper option to tone down the graphical intensity- or whatever it is that causes it to run so poorly.  You cannot progress past these level without painstakingly planning out laggy inputs that are incredbily painful to predict, since your 'cursor' acts erradically once you start flying through the air.  Why does the game stop functioning?  Why is there no 'low quality' setting?  This chapter is bugged and needs a by.

review: The game had a promising start, but when it boiled down to the mechanics, the game was disapointing. The base mechanic only works half the time, which is tolarable for the meatboyesque trial and error levels. The boss fights, on the other hand, lack precision. I gave up on the drill gopher, because the required mechanic for dodging only works about half the time. If you are desperate, play the original flash game. This game isnt worth â‚¬15.

review:
Very easy mechanics to learn/understand indeed (so basic you hardly need to learn nothing...you basically assume the way it is)... very hard to master... 0% frustrating since the devs were kind enough to let you retake from the last point before you died... (with absolutely no loading times) The result: a fun platfomer were some of you will probabbly be able to speed  up... but you can also play in a slower pace (that's the way i need it as i am clumsy as hell)

if you like platfomers this one is pretty simple action fun!

review:
minus all the funny lines its your standard platform puzzle game
you pretty much got your movement, attack gun and you fire it to however gets you to your objective.
there are bosses and some can be easily beaten while others are a pain in the ass.
if i had to say the closet game to this it would have to be battle block threather since you can die about the same if not more in this game but the puzzles are worth it.
also for those who wonder how they found this in there steam liabrary, apparently owners of speedrunners get the game for free if you bought it back in beta

review:
Un gioco semplice ma difficile da padroneggiare...impersoniamo un omino al quale piace ballare sempre (e sempre e sempre e sempre...) che si trova di fronte  molteplici lui del futuro che lo mettono sempre nei casini...grazie alla sua pistola-raggio deve districarsi da livelli sempre + intensi e difficili, ma che vi faranno crepare dalle risate per la loro demenza (mi ricorda molto battleblock teather).
Il gioco Ã¨ davvero divertente e impegnativo, lo si finisce in circa 2 ore se siete abili, altrimenti un poco di piÃ¹ se non lo siete molto...si perde piÃ¹ tempoi poi a cercare tutti i cappelli, o facce (che anche in questo caso ricordano molto battleblock teather). Da prendere ma non al prezzo attuale (15 euro) ma molto in sconto, almeno del 75%.

Voto 6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198075687534', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1464879648}
review:
The game's writing is funny, the art is charming, performance is great...but all that should take a backseat to gameplay and that's where, for me, NTtE falls flat. Combat is difficult, nigh-impossible to control, and dying feels more like being unlucky than actually a penalty. Moving is glacial when you aren't using the excruciatingly hard to control laser gun, giving you a choice between snail and F-15 with one wing as your only options for motion. 

I wanted to like it, but playing feels like a chore. It'd be fine as a free flash game, but $15? No way in hell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104112417', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1642657173}
review:
No Time to Explain Remastered is a platformer by tinyBuild games, and for their first game it's pretty damn good.
Level design is excellent, challenging but still fun. Stages often have their own gimmicks, this keeps the gameplay varied and interesting. The soundtrack is brilliant, and compliments the levels very well. The changes made from the original, particularly those regarding optimisation and controls, are definitely good ones; I run a rairly low-end computer and had lag issues in some sections of the original, all fixed this version. Controls are simple and intuitive, and while different characters will have different methods of getting around, the game does a good job of teaching you how to use them. I found the story to be highly amusing; I won't spoil it here but everything that happens is just so unexpected and ridiculous, it had me laughing out loud more than once. 

Overall, No Time to Explain sets out to be a funny, original platformer, and it succeeded.
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198111244099', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1461340255}
review:
I received this game for free, idk how but it is in my library.

This game is extremely fun and it has its pros and cons.

Pro:
addictive
unique
original
fun
good story line

Cons:
Some levels and boss fights are quite difficult
I rage 2-3 times.
Sometimes, idk how to kill the boss. (So I need to look up the internet to know how to defeat the boss)


This game is recommanded to play from start to finish in 1 sitting. It is only 3 hrs but its content is amazing.

8.5/10

You should buy this game if it is on sale, as for now, $15 is quite expensive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018214616', 'num_games_owned': 1252, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1464955255}
review:
[h1][b]Public Review on behalf of the Opium Pulses Steam group[/b][/h1]

[b]Few words about the game[/b]
No Time To Explain is an amazingly fun platformer game, where you pass levels using the laser cannon or few other tools, fight alien crabs or mecha-pterodactyls or dance off a cake. After this kind of description of a game, I really have no clue what you're waiting for, there's no time to explain, it's just perfect!

[b]Advantages[/b]
[list]
[*] - Totally random and stupid humor - I love every bit of it
[*] - Ton of fun, non repetitive levels to pass through
[*] - Collectives are everywhere, but it's challenging to get some of them
[*] - Music and voice acting are awesome
[*] - Local co-op
[*] - Game controls well in my opinion (tested on keyboard+mouse and controller)
[*] - Nice, cartoon graphics, typical for tinyBuild
[*] - Great level editor
[/list]

[b]Disadvantages[/b]
[list]
[*] - Plot is somehow random and it's not in the fun way - it doesn't connect to itself and appears only once every few levels
[*] - Price tag is too high for what the game offers
[/list]

[b]Summary[/b]
Simply fun and clever game, hits perfectly in my type of humor. It's fairly easy to pass, so rage quits - typical for some platform games - shouldn't happen, playing it is pure pleasure. Achievements are quite challenging, so beating this game once won't be enough for achiev hunters. Too bad that the story is not made in a different way, because for how it is now, it doesn't really "play any big role" in the game, unfortunately. But overall, I had some major fun playing it, as well as in the co-op and in single player mode.

Personal score
[table]
[tr]
[th]
9 / 10
[/th]
[/tr]
[/table]

[i]If you find my review helpful or funny be sure to follow [b]Opium Pulses[/b] curator page right [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/OpiumPulsesNews#curation]here[/url] for more reviewed games![/i]

review:
Heureusement qu'on l'a eu gratuit avec l'achat de Speedrunners, parce que 15â‚¬ pour 3h de jeu, Ã§'aurait fait mal aux couilles.
Le jeu est bien, le concept est marrant, mais c'est court, on dirait une simple introduction pour les levels par les joueurs. Les intro des diffÃ©rents mondes sont marrant, Ã©normÃ©ment de chapeaux (cc TF2) en somme c'est beaucoup de bruit pour pas grand-chose.
A partir de la "seconde" partie du jeu, tu vois que Ã§a devient moins drÃ´le : le protagoniste du futur qui ne balance plus de phrases dÃ©biles tout en Ã©tant choppÃ© par un requin : "Comment je fais pour perdre autant de sang ? C'est absuuuurde !!", t'as l'impression que cette seconde partie n'est que du remplissage pour essayer de justifier difficilement les 15â‚¬. Et le niveau consacrÃ© Ã  l'art troll bien le jeu en lui-mÃªme sur ce point.
Les 4 achievements sur la vitesse d'exÃ©cution de stages (sans mourir ou pas) montrent bien la tentative de rallonge le jeu Ã  outrance. On s'Ã©tonne qu'il n'y ait pas un achievement speedrun sur l'entiÃ¨retÃ© du jeu.

Pour 15â‚¬ autant se faire joyeusement latter les couilles sur Dark Souls en ajoutant 5â‚¬ si vous le prenez pas en solde. Vous y gagnerez en rapport qualitÃ©/prix.
Ou mieux, prenez Counter Strike Global Offensive. Pour 14â‚¬, vous pourrez jouer sur plusieurs modes de jeux et accessoirement apprendre le russe et Ã  gÃ©rer votre self-control. TrÃ¨s avantageux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044145867', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1461197817}
review:
Got game for free for some reason

SPOILERS

The game has a good sense of humor and a great fast paced start throwing you right into the action, or it would do that if action actually meant a frustrating and broken game 

The level design is despite the major opinion, quite repetitive and boring, you can spend 5 minutes a level trying to line up the one correct angle. 

The first boss fight is incredibly easy and I beat it first attempt, the second is the biggest example of unfair controls and bad design choices, the fight has you against a shark with 3 platforms to stand on, attempting to shoot the shark (what you're meant to do) will knock you off the platforms and into the spikes surrounding the level or off the bottom world bound. 
The Attacks are almost unpredictable, the boss will jump up, and MIGHT go after you, or might drop a bomb on the surface, both of which are unavoidable if you guess incorrectly to no fault of your own

The third boss is where I gave up out of pure frustration, it has 4 orbs that pull your beam cannon in like a magnetic field, but you have to shoot the stationary boss with your cannon. as soon as you destroy the armor it slams down, killing you if you stand in the middle of the stage and shocking you to death if you stand on the floor at all
Meanwhile objects fall from the sky that block movement  and kill you if they land on you. this would be decent design if the background and falling objects weren't the SAME COLOR

Occasionally the Beam Cannon just fails to work at all
The jump button is practically useless
Future you is screaming in pain every time you respawn
Options menu is lacking
Framerate locked at 60
Graphics are lazy

TL:DR
If you got it for free like I did, go ahead and give it a go
If you are thinking of buying it, don't

review:
Este juego lo he recibido asi, por mi carita bonita. Lo he probado, y os traigo un pequeÃ±o analisis de este juego.

Para empezar, es un juego que requiere de cierta habilidad con las manos, asi como tambien saber como pasarse ciertas partes, que pueden resultar un verdadero quebradero de cabeza. Luego, la parte que mas me molesta de este juego: hay zonas en las que, si o si, necesitas a un segundo jugador para pasarlo. Digo que me molesta, porque soy mas de jugar sola, y tener que depender de otro jugador no me gusta.

Lo he recibido gratis y le he dado una oportunidad, pero no ha pasado la prueba.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056739666', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1464989207}
review: The developers have no time to explain how this piece of crap got into my library. It's not a smart, simple platformer, but instead a buggy and lazy one, as there is a major difference between a difficult game (a game that you can enjoy in the end) and a frustrating one. No time to explain is the second one. The levels of the platformer are poorly designed, the mechanics are simplistic, and they feel dumb. I won't even get started on how bad the controls are, because this started out as a flash game, and I would expect nothing more from it than the uninspired piece of junk with forced humour that it turned out to be. No, the game is not funny. No, it is not like Super Meat Boy. It represents the worst aspects of platforming and creativity combined (tough the dislike of the art style is pure prefference). Just do yourself a favor and save the $ 15 you would spend on this game. You won't regret not buying it. Maybe grab it at a sale if you really wish to try out the hour or so of content it has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067943604', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1461119603}
review:
(Played with Keyboard and Mouse)
Okay so i took my time to 100% the game(so my playtime might give you a clue about how much time it takes to complete the game), cause its not a very long game and the playtime in general is alright i guess. 
The story is silly and fun with some quite simple platformer puzzles. 
Graphics and sound are alright i guess, nothing special really but i enjoyed it.
Levels are short so you dont have to spend too much time in them and its allways obvious what you have to do (go from the start to a fancy portal. pretty simple.)
There are also some nice ideas of how you can get thru a 2d world with different movement types. 
This is the point where i have to talk about why i wouldnt recommend it though: while there are several nice ideas of movement, the way it handles is just insanely frustrating. the "normal" way (big laser that you basicly see everywhere getting used) seems like it has some mouse smoothing or something which wasnt too bad but a bit annoying. The main reason i have to talk bad about movement is cause of the ways you have to move in later levels, it feels horrible. while your character moves towards your mouse for example you can move your mouse around, so you can move the character while in the air with a new movement command, BUT you cant see where you move your mouse while your character is still moving towards your old mouse location actually go up and not drop down, making it very annoying to make precise quick movements like going up and then a sharp right turn or something cause you have no idea where your mouse exactly is.
Also it seems buggy meaning that the movement suddenly stopped a few times, spikes kill you and dont spawn you where you should spawn and the boost in the air you get from shooting below you sometimes didnt really work the way it should either (big boost when on the ground - small boost while in the air when you jumped before you shoot)
Setting wise ... there is nothing really. You cant change controls, you cant change resolution. atleast you could change the audio volume and mouse sensitivity.
All in all its a fun idea but bad execution. I got it for free so i dont regret giving it a few hours but i cant recommend buying it.

review: No Time To Explain stupisce per simpatia e semplicitÃ . l'ho giocato senza grandi aspettative e me lo sono bevuto tutto d'un sorso. la grafica ricorda i giochi flash sul web ed effettivamente Ã¨ li che nasce questo titolo. come platform non Ã¨ difficile e gli achievements non hanno aspettative troppo alte. +1 per l'idea dei cappelli che oltre a variegare un pÃ² il personaggio, alzano un pÃ² la barretta della sfida nel recuperarli tutti. nota negativa, dopo una lunga sessione di gioco, il vibrare no-stop dello visuale quando si usa il laser mi stava dando il voltastomaco.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968981708', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1459860740}
review:
God, I wish I could set up a double recommendation.

I love the story. Becauseâ€¦ it is somewhat creative and the game keeps this running gag about no time just throughout the whole story.

The levels are challenging but never really unfair. They will test your skills and you will become better while beating the game, beating it a second time is not as hard as the first time. Each grand section introduces some kind of new mechanic which keeps a refreshing pace of changes when a new section starts. Some parodies of games are in there as well, you will spot them when they are there.

It is a nice filler if you just want to play something oldschool with some weird physics and a gun which is more used like some kind of jetpack. The soundtrack is well made, you feel remindet to many other games which already are out there as well. Yes, Top Gear from the SNES will come back into your ears as wellâ€¦

Oh and the hatsâ€¦ I still did not collect all of them, I am missing 4 of themâ€¦

GET THIS GAME! You will definitly not regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025674597', 'num_games_owned': 2061, 'num_reviews': 607, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1458001188}
review:
A remastered edition of No Time To Explain (well, duh), which fixes several of the issues found in the original game (basically, that it'd run like crap in most systems without some messing around). It also includes other changes, mostly regarding some of the weapons, which, in some cases, makes them more difficult to use. Not that I dislike the added challenge, it's just something to keep in mind.

In case you have no idea what No Time To Explain is, because you never played the original game, it's a platformer game with a pretty hilarious story about time travelling, alternate realities, paradoxes, etc. It has lots of humour, so it's already worth it by that. Even then, I can say it's also a pretty solid platformer from a gameplay point of view; the different levels offer some interesting puzzles, in which you must use your weapon to move around safely. The soundtrack is pretty good as well, it has that chiptune style from old platformers, and it fits really well in this game.

So, to conclude, I can say I recommend No Time To Explain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035826801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 643, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1456164220}
review:
Fun game in co-op and single player, but has some flaws and is rather pricy when thinking about hours of gameplay. You might see me having 6 hours played at the time of posting this review, but that's mainly because of local co-op.

Pros:

- Fun setting and refreshing mechanics
- Good soundtrack
- Replayability (collectibles, achievements)
- Local multiplayer
- A bit challenging

Cons:

- At times, movement. Your cursor is automatically set to bottom left of your character if you respawn somewhere, land on something or if your co-op partner lands somewhere
- When playing in co-op, the camera can be annoying as it doesn't zoom out to show both players... meaning actually it's better to only let one player play every now and then.
- Short *hint*^^^^
- Level editor is very basic

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198046262592', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1437534288}
review:
this claim of 'remastered' is just a cash grab, even if they've changed engines, it still performs as bad and there is absolutely NO different in the original version other than it being a much harder feat with the already floaty mechanics using the laser gun and cake power up. They added a live system into the fights which only makes them last much longer


I could pull up a side by side comparison with the original version of this game and there would be absolutely nothing apart from this other than the weird new trailer this is a farce buy if you want to give it a shot but not out of the belief that it's any better just that it's the same level of frustration when you get into season 2

author: {'steamid': '76561198039948388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1450331904}
review:
The game is weird, and not necessarily in a bad way. It's definitely stylistic and interesting, but I find the fundamental mechanics frustrating in an un-fun way.

This game is a control screw game. You're going to navigate mazes with a difficult to control gun. Shoot the gun, and it recoils you. Use the recoil to fly through spike filled tunnels. Now do it while you're on fire to burn down some wooden barricades before you die. Die, reset. Try again.

If that sounds fun, you'll like the game. I did not enjoy the basic mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091682568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1449849105}
review:
I got a free copy since I owned the original version of the game.

I was looking over my older review of No Time To Explain and I think I was more patient back then, the game can by fun but also really frustrating. It's a game with a lovely concept that falls below in design.

The game claimed itself as a comedy platformer. They got the comedy right for sure. I love the writing and dialogue it's quite hilarious as it's about stopping your evil self with a goatee from ruining the past. The plot is bonkers and quite fun to watch. Gameplay however is very frustrating and feels clunky. Precision in a platformer is necessary and this game doesn't do it well. Bosses are all over the place as the difficulty curve waves frantically.

As a remaster it's pretty good. A lot of bugs have been fixed and new features have been added such as controller support and co-op. The level editor is still there so a community can stay present here. To conclude I think this game is worth your time if you can forgive its flaws. There is a game with heart that tinyBuild has made here. It can just get rage inducing though so keep that in mind. Campaign is short too so maybe wait on a sale. I give it a 6/10

review:
This is brilliant.
No Time to Explain was already amazing on its first version.
No Time to Explain REMASTERED had:
    - Fixed glitches and bugs

author: {'steamid': '76561198003970062', 'num_games_owned': 2038, 'num_reviews': 355, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1448523560}
review:
â€œIâ€™m you from the future! Thereâ€™s no time to explain!â€

	Thus begins No Time To Explain, a game which seems so promising as you chase your future self through the first few levels as he screams about being horribly mangled by the giant enemy crab who sets off the whole story.

	While this is funny â€“ and a very strong start â€“ unfortunately, the game rather goes downhill from there. This is not because the gameplay becomes any worse, but because, while the silly story continues, it just isnâ€™t as continuous after that point. It mostly takes place after zones, rather than getting those reminders in-zone of what is going on and what your goal is, and consequently, it basically ends up boiling down to the puzzles.

	Now, this isnâ€™t entirely bad; the game is built up around the 2D platforming puzzles that make it up. There are a number of zones, and in most of the zones, you gain a new ability unique to that zone to help propel you through that zone â€“ or else, there is some unique new gimmick the new zone has. Both work decently enough, and the variety means that the levels seldom feel too samey. All of the areas are quite short as well, meaning that you never end up spending too much time on any given level, and the respawns are pretty generous, with frequent checkpoints (with a couple of exceptions which largely make sense).

	But a big part of the charm of the game is the ridiculous plot of you from the future warning you from the present, and the various silly things that happen as a result of that recursion, and without that in a lot of the game, it just kind of feelsâ€¦ there.

	However, the biggest flaw with this game is that it is a puzzle platformer with deliberately poor controls â€“ that is to say, it is intentionally difficult to control your character and get them to do exactly what you want them to do. The primary challenge is making whatever janky ability you have in a new area work for you and aid you in getting through the stages without struggling too much. While the controls are not â€œlooseâ€ in the sense of being inconsistent, they are certainly finicky, and it is often more or less trial and error in getting just the right angle on your abilities to clear many obstacles. It isnâ€™t that you donâ€™t know what youâ€™re supposed to do, it is that actually executing on what youâ€™re supposed to do is quite hard â€“ ultimately, the game is more of a technical challenge than an intellectual one.

	The game itself feels a little bit cheap as well â€“ the graphics are unimpressive, and the whole thing feels like it was made in Flash. Thereâ€™s just nothing really there to impress, and while there are a few levels later on â€“ in particular, the art level â€“ which do more, it just isnâ€™t really something that changed my mind about the game.

	For all its flaws, the game isnâ€™t bad. But it is kind of mediocre. I donâ€™t regret my time playing it, but it isnâ€™t anything to write home about, either, and your life will not be forever less for not playing it. It is passable, but no more.
